post_text:
Great News! ALL students eat FREE Preschool - 12th grade!

This will last AT LEAST through the month of September and hopefully through December as long as government funding remains available.

This also applies to students enrolled in the Virtual Program and any other kids in the community. Off-campus students can pick up meals through the elementary loop line between Noon and 1:00 PM.

*Elementary school will still eat free through the end of the school year, this is just additional funding for the MS and HS.

post_text:
School Calendar Revision:

Arcadia Valley R-II Schools has made a change in the 2020-21 School Calendar. The first day of school with students will now be Tuesday, September 8.

The main reason for the change was made in response to current and pending situations with staff members, including some key staff members, relating to the COVID-19 pandemic.

AV Schools still plans to begin with the option of face to face learning, in addition to the virtual option on that date. The prior scheduled days lost will simply be added to the end of the year in May, so that no school days will be lost.

We are truly sorry for the inconvenience this has caused.

Please contact your child's building office between 8:00 - 3:00 M-F if you have any questions.

*We will have those answers to the questions on the Virtual Learning Platform that were submitted early next week. So sorry, we had several other things thrown on us this week to deal with and weren't able to answer all your questions, but we will. Thanks.
text:
School Calendar Revision:

Arcadia Valley R-II Schools has made a change in the 2020-21 School Calendar. The first day of school with students will now be Tuesday, September 8.

The main reason for the change was made in response to current and pending situations with staff members, including some key staff members, relating to the COVID-19 pandemic.

AV Schools still plans to begin with the option of face to face learning, in addition to the virtual option on that date. The prior scheduled days lost will simply be added to the end of the year in May, so that no school days will be lost.

We are truly sorry for the inconvenience this has caused.

Please contact your child's building office between 8:00 - 3:00 M-F if you have any questions.

*We will have those answers to the questions on the Virtual Learning Platform that were submitted early next week. So sorry, we had several other things thrown on us this week to deal with and weren't able to answer all your questions, but we will. Thanks.

One of our options for beginning this school year is our Virtual Learning Program (off campus learning). To enroll your child in the program to begin the year please complete this form:

A paper form will also be put in registration packets (coming soon) and the information will also be posted on our website.

*you may transition back to the regular on campus classroom at any time

**you may also sign up for this program at anytime during the 2020-2021 school year

***more questions/information about the program is found on in above link and even more will come available over time

****if you have questions about the program, please contact your child's office beginning August 12

post_text: Join us ONLINE as AVHS recognizes its Academic Awards for the 2019 - 2020 School Year.
text: Join us ONLINE as AVHS recognizes its Academic Awards for the 2019 - 2020 School Year.

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Eli Jones

After graduation, Eli plans to attend Webster University where he will major in Film and Television Production. Ten years from now he hopes to be surrounded by friends and family while pursuing a fulfilling career.

While at AV, Eli was involved in FBLA, NHS, Cross Country, Track, Student Council, and Band. His favorite AVHS memory - Karaoke days with Coach Thompson and the thing he'll miss the most are all of his friends and the great staff members who helped him get where he is today.

Eli's staff shoutout goes to his coach and teacher, Mr. Barzowski. His reason for choosing him - "for being a bro."

Eli, you've left an imprint on us here at AV and we can't wait to see all the amazing things you'll do at Webster!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Tharin Sellers

After graduation, Tharin plans to enter the workforce as a heavy equipment operator and hopes to make a career out of the profession. While at AVHS, Tharin was involved in our CTC welding program and says that this is the thing that he'll miss the most about AV. His favorite memories involve cutting a few donuts in the parking lot when the weather was just right.

Tharin would like to give a staff shoutout to Mr. Royer and Mrs. Rice for always pushing him to do his work!

Tharin, we wish you all the best as you begin your career - AV will miss you!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Skyler Bishop

After graduation, Skyler plans to go to Mineral Area College to pursue a degree in theatre. He hopes his studies there will be the next step in his pursuit to make it big someday!

While at AV, Skyler was involved in Band, FBLA, Special Olympics, and our Spring Productions. Skyler's favorite memories from high school are all of the productions that he has been a part of and all of the love and support people have shown him and his friends. The things he will miss the most about high school are his friends and teachers.

Skyler would like to give a shoutout to his good friend, Emma Nelson, for always supporting and understanding him.

We will certainly miss seeing your face on the AVHS stage, Skyler. Best of luck in your future endeavors!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Kaylee Goodman

After graduating from AV, Kaylee plans to attend the police academy at Mineral Area College. A decade from now, she hopes to be working hard and raising her own family.

Kaylee's favorite memories from high school are calling Mr. Rice her BFF and getting to be a part of all of the rallies and assemblies. The thing she'll miss the most about AV are the close bonds she has with her friends, and getting to see all of her teachers.

Kaylee's staff shoutout goes to Coach Key - for always having a smile on his face and making sure that she is okay. "He is always full of happiness, hugs, and high-fives."

Kaylee, thank you for your dedication to public service after high school - all the best at MAC next year!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Payton Wadlow

After graduation, Payton plans to enter the workforce. She eventually would like to work on Union Pacific Railroad with her dad and have a big farm like him.

While at AV, Payton was involved in Health Sciences and FFA. She says she has too many memories to narrow them down to one favorite, but the things she will miss the most are her friends!

Payton, it has been a pleasure to be a part of your journey! All the best as you enter the workforce!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Erica Davis

After graduation Erica plans to enter the workforce. Eventually she plans to attend college where she can fulfill her ultimate goal of working in the medical field as an RN or doctor.

While at AV, Erica was involved in FFA, Art Club, and the JAG program. Her favorite memory from high school was getting to watch her sister's senior night. The thing she will miss the most is seeing her friends every day and all of the music and fun activities in the hallway.

Erica's staff shout out goes to Mr. Trowbridge and Mrs. Ackley for teaching her things she didn't know how to do before.

Erica, we are so proud of all of your hard work that has gotten you this far! Best of luck next year as you enter the world of work.

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Kaleb Melton

Kaleb plans to attend the University of Central Missouri to work toward a bachelor's degree to become a professional pilot someday.

While at AVHS, Kaleb was involved in Basketball, Baseball, Golf, Track, Art Club, Science Club, and Pep Club. He competed in the MAC math competition, MAC Art Show, and is and A+ and Honors student.

Kaleb's favorite memories are the times he spent with friends and he will miss sports the most. His staff shout out goes to Mr. Cantrell who taught him in middle school! According to Kaleb, Mr. Cantrell was his favorite teacher and stayed in touch with him from middle school all the way through graduation!

We'll definitely be looking to the sky for you in a few years, Kaleb! Best of luck at UCM in the fall!

Join us, as we join other community members, for our final Friday Night Lights event this Friday evening at 8:20PM. The class of 2020 will take to the streets in a parade style cruise down Park Drive and Main Street Ironton one last time as an AVHS student!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Adrian Mills

After graduation, Adrian plans to enter the workforce. In ten years Adrian sees himself working and having his own place.

While in high school, Adrian was involved in Special Olympics in Track and Field and in Bowling. He was a member of the AVHS Unified Basketball Team. Adrian's favorite memory from high school was getting to escort Katie Whited at homecoming this year. The thing he'll miss most about school are his friends and sports.

Adiran would like to give a staff shoutout to Coach Thompson for helping him get stronger!

Adrian we will miss seeing your contagious smile in the hallway and your Tiger (and St. Louis Cardinal) Spirit! All the best next year as you enter the workforce!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Alexandra Mcwherter

After graduation, Allie plans to attend St. Louis College of Pharmacy. A decade from now she hopes to be in her career as a dentist, starting a family, and owning her own home.

While in high school, Allie was involved in Pep Club, Art Club, and NHS. Her favorite memory from school was the day so many students all wore red in support of one of their peers. The thing Allie will miss the most are her daily lunches in Mrs. Turner's room with friends.

Allie's staff shout out goes to Mr. Hargiss for always proving that there is light at the end of the tunnel!

We agree with Mr. Hargiss, Allie, there is light at the end but graduation is just your beginning. We wish you all the best next year in college!

post_text:
KINDERGARTEN ROUNDUP

Kindergarten Roundup/Enrollment for the 2020-21 school year will be May 26 -29 for children who will be five years old by July 30, 2020. This is by appointment only, no walk-ins.

Please call the elementary office to make an appointment (573) 546-9700 beginning May 11 during the hours of 8:00 - 11:00 and 12:00 - 3:00.

We will abide by the CDC guidelines for social distancing. We ask that only one adult accompany each student. We also ask that no siblings attend. Please bring a copy of your child’s birth certificate, social security card, shot record, and proof of residency. We look forward to welcoming our newest students in the fall!
text:
KINDERGARTEN ROUNDUP

Kindergarten Roundup/Enrollment for the 2020-21 school year will be May 26 -29 for children who will be five years old by July 30, 2020. This is by appointment only, no walk-ins.

Please call the elementary office to make an appointment (573) 546-9700 beginning May 11 during the hours of 8:00 - 11:00 and 12:00 - 3:00.

We will abide by the CDC guidelines for social distancing. We ask that only one adult accompany each student. We also ask that no siblings attend. Please bring a copy of your child’s birth certificate, social security card, shot record, and proof of residency. We look forward to welcoming our newest students in the fall!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Corbin Rea

The Arcadia Valley R-2 School District expresses its sincerest condolences to the family and friends of a beloved Tiger and member of the Class of 2020, Corbin Rea, who passed away on Friday. Corbin was a member of the Pep Club, National Honors Society, and A+ Program. He loved sports and played on the Arcadia Valley Tigers Basketball and Baseball teams. He was recently accepted into a State Tech. program to become a Lineman and during the summer he worked at Johnson Shut-ins State Park.

Visitation for Corbin will be held today, Tuesday, May 5 from 3:00-8:00 PM at the Cole Family Chapel. A Celebration of Life Service will be Wednesday, May 6 at 12:00 PM.

Visitation for Corbin will be held today, Tuesday, May 5 from 3:00-8:00 PM at the Cole Family Chapel. A Celebration of Life Service will be Wednesday, May 6 at 12:00 PM.

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Zachary Robison

After graduating from AVHS, Zachary plans to enter the workforce.

The thing Zachary will miss the most about high school are his teachers, especially Mrs. Walker! He wanted to give his staff shoutout to her for being "the most chill teacher I have ever had."

Zachary, we will miss seeing you every day and wish you all the best as you enter the workforce!

Zachary, we will miss seeing you every day and wish you all the best as you enter the workforce!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Stephen Pursley

After graduation, Stephen plans to attend Drury University where he will play baseball and pursue a degree in exercise physiology. He hopes to practice sports medicine as a career someday.

While at AV, Stephen was involved in Baseball, Basketball, Cross Country, Band, Pep Club, and NHS. Some of his favorite memories from high school are grinding it out every day with his teammates who become more like brothers on the athletic stage. The thing he'll miss the most are all of the great times/interactions he had with people in school and especially on the athletic teams he was a member of.

Stephen's staff shoutout goes to his dad, Mr. Steve Pursley, "for always being there to help me, check on me, encourage me, and push me to achieve what he knows I can."

Stephen, you're a leader both on and off the field, and we're excited to see you continue the thing you love at Drury University next year!

post_text: We are thankful for our community partnerships with First State Community Bank, the Mineral Area Council on the Arts, and cities of Arcadia, Ironton, and Pilot Knob. Some of our students’ artwork will be on display soon!
shared_text:
MINERALAREAARTS.ORG
Arcadia Valley Banners Coming Soon! - Mineral Area Council on the Arts

AV Art
April 7 at 11:45 PM ·

AV art kids are at it again. This project has been in the works for some time and I’m so excited to announce it. We all need something to lift our spirits. Keep an eye on the streets of Ironton. First State community Bank, the MACOA and the city have chosen student art work to be made into banners and hung on Main Street in Ironton. I can’t wait to see all the beautiful banners.

MINERALAREAARTS.ORG
Arcadia Valley Banners Coming Soon! - Mineral Area Council on the Arts

AV Art
April 7 at 11:45 PM ·

AV art kids are at it again. This project has been in the works for some time and I’m so excited to announce it. We all need something to lift our spirits. Keep an eye on the streets of Ironton. First State community Bank, the MACOA and the city have chosen student art work to be made into banners and hung on Main Street in Ironton. I can’t wait to see all the beautiful banners.

post_text: Friday Night Lights 8:20 PM
text: Friday Night Lights 8:20 PM

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Lakyn Douglas

Lakyn plans to attend Mineral Area College after graduation and sees herself living and working abroad in Italy in ten years.

While in high school, Lakyn was involved in Art Club, Dance Squad, Pep Club, Science Club, and NHS. Her favorite memory from AV is her entire freshman year and the thing she'll miss the most is getting to hang out with her friends.

Lakyn would like to give her staff shoutout to all of her teachers and the staff at AV for doing such a great job in having a hand at raising all the students here.

Lakyn, we see your hard work and can't wait to follow your European adventures in the future!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: David Layton

After graduation, David plans to attend State Technical College of Missouri to earn a certificate in heavy equipment operations. In ten years he hopes to have settled into a career as an equipment operator with a home and maybe a spouse.

While at AVHS, David was involved in Skills USA, and his favorite memories are his time spent in Auto Body class and in the weight room.

The thing he'll miss the most about AV is not seeing his friends on a daily basis and wondering what happened to his peers. David's staff shoutout goes to Mr. Corby Turner, his automotive instructor because he gives great advice and is always willing to work with anyone as long as they try their hardest.

David, your hard work in high school has proven that you'll be a great edition to your profession - we wish you all the best!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Shailyn Robinson

Shailyn plans to attend Mineral Area College and began her pursuit of becoming a nurse. She hopes to continue her education and eventual becoming a doctor and working in her own practice while also raising a family.

While at AVHS, Shailyn was involved in Concert Choir, Women's Choir, Basketball, and competed at the Show Me the Constitution State competition representing AV. She was a part of several groups that received one ratings at vocal competitions, was a member of Skills USA, was enrolled into the CNA program at the AVCTC, and was chosen to represent her class as the 2019 senior Fall Festival Queen Candidate which was her favorite memory from high school.

Shailyn will miss all of her teachers and friends and would like to give a special staff shoutout to Mrs. Jackson, our CNA instructor, for always supporting her and making sure that each of her students understood everything that they were learning.

Shailyn, we are excited to see all of the lives that will be touched by your career!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Elizabeth Eakins

Elizabeth plans to attend college after graduation to pursue a bachelor's degree at Rochester Institute of Technology in New York. In ten years she sees herself in a job that she loves and raising a family of her own.

Elizabeth's favorite memory from high school is her entire junior year. She is a highly gifted artist and will hopefully get to use that ability in her future career someday.

The thing Elizabeth will miss the most about high school are the close friendships she has developed. Her staff shoutout goes out to Mrs. Dinkins, who according to Elizabeth, taught her to be the person she is today.

Elizabeth, we are so proud of that person you have become and will miss seeing that smiling face in the hallways every day!

post_text:
Many of our teachers are trying to find creative ways to continue some form of learning for our students while we are on CoronaBreak.

8th grade Science teacher, Mr Hargiss has been creating and posting his own videos for his science classes. But we think they are interesting for anyone! Feel free to check them out. Some of his other videos will be posted in the comments.

Reminder: Online resources can be found on our webpage at www.avr2.org and on available teacher’s Google Classrooms.

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Trevor Stallins

After graduation, Trevor plans to pursue a career as a heavy equipment operator. While in high school, Trevor was involved in Skills USA, and claims that his favorite memory was his car!

Trevor will miss all of his friendships and would like to give a staff shoutout to our high school art teacher, Mrs. Turner!

Trevor, we know that your hard work will help you be successful at whatever job you do. We'll miss seeing you in the halls at AV!

Trevor, we know that your hard work will help you be successful at whatever job you do. We'll miss seeing you in the halls at AV!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Logan Pannebecker

Logan plans to attend State Technical College of Missouri to pursue a degree in Utility Systems Technician. He hopes to take the knowledge he learns there to begin a career working for a fiber optics company.

Some of Logan's best memories from high school revolve around playing sports with some of his best friends. While at AV, Logan was involved in Baseball, Basketball, NHS, Skills USA, and FBLA. He'll miss never getting to play high school basketball again after graduation.

Logan's staff shoutout goes to Mr. Cliff Yates. "He always pushes me to grow up and turn into a man. Whether it was knowledge of the trade of construction to common grown-up knowledge, he always knew where to guide me in life and I greatly appreciate him for that."

Logan, we're excited to see what the future holds for you!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Kolter McBride

Kolter plans to attend Southeast Lineman Training Center to receive training to become an electrical lineman where he hopes to pursue his career.

While at AV, Kolter was involved in Baseball, Golf, Tennis, and Skills USA. His favorite memories from high school involve spending time with his friends and the thing he will miss most is baseball and the friendships he was able to make.

Kolter's staff shoutout goes to Mr. Cliff Yates, our Construction Technology instructor. According to Kolter, "He cared about everyone in the school no matter if they were his student or not. He always pushed me to be a better person and treated everyone as his own."

Kolter, we're glad you're going to put that career tech training into action as a journeyman lineman someday soon! All the best in your future endeavors!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Hunter Browers

Hunter plans to enter the workforce upon graduation at AV and soon you might catch a glimpse of him working on the railroad! In ten years, Hunter sees himself living in Ironton on a farm and being a functional part of society.

Hunter has a lot of great memories from high school but his favorites involve working on cars with Sam Layton in our Automotive Technology Program. While at AVHS, Hunter was involved in Science Club, Skills USA, and was a champion for our Career Tech program!

Hunter will miss all of his friends and the staff at AV. His staff shoutout goes to Mr. Sam Layton, who "was one of the best teachers and a great friend" and whom Hunter hopes can still be the one to hand him his diploma at graduation.

We sure hope that can happen too, Hunter! We're so proud of how hard you worked at AV and how hard you will continue to work in your new job.

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Nathaniel Burgan

Nathaniel will be enrolling at Mineral Area College in the fall and plans to pursue a career in music education. In ten years he hopes to be employed in his field and conducting his own choir!

While at AVHS, Nathaniel was involved in Scholar Bowl and Concert Choir and his favorite memory was getting to be a part of receiving an ensemble rating of I at contest. The thing he'll miss the most is seeing his friends all of the time.

Nathaniel's staff shoutout goes to Mr. Cantrell "for always helping me with my math" and Mr. Hartwig " for putting up with all of my dumb questions."

We're sure your questions weren't dumb, Nate! Keep chasing your dream to create and nurture music in your own students someday!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Shyanna Orrick

Shyanna plans to attend Mineral Area College to begin her education to become a teacher. In ten years, Shyanna sees herself as an elementary school teacher and high school cheer coach, while also raising a family.

While at AV, Shyanna was involved in Cheer, Science Club, Art Club, and softball. Her favorite memories from high school are going into her freshman year and all of the fun she has had since. She will miss all of the nice and amazing people that were a part of her education at AV.

Shyanna's staff shoutout goes to Mrs. Siebert, her teacher from many years ago, Mrs. Siebert made an impact on her simply because she is such a nice teacher.

Shyanna, we are so proud that your education at AV has led you to want to be an educator yourself! We wish you all the best as you pursue your next step!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Kristina Govro

Kristina plans to enroll in college to become a secondary English teacher and in the future hopes to become a creative writing professor at the college level.

While in high school, Kristina was involved in Concert Choir, NHS, and Science Club. Her favorite memories from high school are getting to see her friends and going to events with the choir and says that these are also the things she'll miss the most - friends, choir, and her teachers.

Kristina would like to give Mr. Neff a staff shoutout because he, "has helped me break out of my shell and become a strong soprano in choir."

We think you're strong at a lot of things, Kristina, and can't wait to see your face on the back of a best selling book!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Kandis Miller

Kandis claims she's "a live in the moment kind of person" who doesn't like to think too far ahead of herself, but she does have plans to attend cosmetology school after graduating from AVHS.

Kandis's greatest memories from high school all revolve around her involvement in our music program, specifically making it to state for both her solo and ensembles. While at AV, Kandis was involved in Concert Choir, Pop Choir, was all-district for choir, and was part of several groups who received 1 ratings at competitions throughout the years.

Kandis would like to give a staff shoutout to Mr. Neff, our vocal music teacher, because he was always there for her and helped her become a better singer and a better person.

Kandis, we're so proud of all of the ways you made AV a great place to be! Keep singing, and we'll keep cheering you on!

text:
Lights at the AVHS Ball field at 8:20 tonight and also luminaries in front of gym for the 66 graduates of the class of 2020.

*Please follow all social distancing guidelines.

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Autumn Thomas

After high school Autumn isn't quite decided about what her plans will entail, however, in ten years she plans to be settled into a good job and hopes to be happy with where life has her. While at AVHS, Autumn was involved in Cross Country, Concert Choir, Science Club and Track. Her favorite AVHS memory is getting to go to state for Cross Country her senior year.

Autumn will miss her favorite teacher and coach. Her staff shoutout goes to her Track and Cross Country coach, Mr. Barzowski. "He's been my coach for 4 years, and he's always believed in me, even when I doubted myself."

Cheers to you, Autumn! We have no doubt that you'll take all of those lessons learned and turn them into something wonderful!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Emma Wadlow

Emma plans to enroll at Mineral Area College where she will pursue the EMT program. While at AVHS she was involved in FFA, NHS, the Honors Program, Cheerleading, Dance Squad, Skills USA, and was pursuing her CNA certification this year through our Career Technical Center.

Emma's favorite memory from high school was being crowned the 2016 Fall Festival Queen with the help and support of her class. She'll miss seeing all of her friends and getting to participate in all of AV's traditions. Emma's staff shoutout goes to Coach Mike Key, because according to her, he always has a smile on his face and a high five to give out!

Emma, we're so proud of you and can't wait to see how you serve your community as an EMT!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Daniel Horn

Daniel plans to attend college and pursue a career in law. In ten years he sees himself fresh out of college, working a lot in a city. While at AVHS, Daniel was involved in Basketball, Tennis, and FFA and says that his favorite high school memories involve playing sports with all of his friends.

Daniel will miss his coaches and the AV staff and wants to give a special staff shoutout to Coach Thompson who has helped him through many things and taught him a lot about the real world.

We've seen your successes on the court and look forward to now seeing them off, Daniel!

post_text:
Senior Spotlight: Samatha Racer

Samantha plans to attend college and in ten years can see herself still hanging out with her gals all the time! According to Sam, she was "involved in a whole lot" in high school, but we could frequently see her on the basketball court, cheering on her friends in the stands, working hard in college classes, and being involved in STUCO.

Her favorite memory from high school was racing Mr. Barzowski and Mr. Adams down the hall while pushing Katie Whited in a shopping cart. Samantha will miss seeing all of the great people everyday and the caring staff, but she says she'll mostly miss Mr. Barzowski. Samatha's staff shoutout goes to...you guessed it, Mr. Barzowski - for always being a welcoming teacher and treating her so wonderfully.

We'll miss seeing your smiling face at AV, Samantha!

Senior Spotlight: Emma Nelson

Emma plans to attend college and one day hopes to own her own dance studio and raise a family. While at AVHS Emma was involved in Dance Squad, FBLA, Student Council, and was the 2018 Fall Festival Queen. She will miss all of her teachers and wants to give a Staff Shoutout to Mrs.Spitzmiller, who teaches advanced math courses. According to Emma, Mrs. Spitzmiller was always encouraging, even with the toughest of problems!

We are so proud of you, Emma, and can't wait to see the great things you do!

post_text: Friday night lights at the AV ball field and Sports Complex. There are 66 signs out. One representing each member of the AVHS class of 2020. Lights on Friday nights at 8:20 pm in honor of the class of 2020.
text: Friday night lights at the AV ball field and Sports Complex. There are 66 signs out. One representing each member of the AVHS class of 2020. Lights on Friday nights at 8:20 pm in honor of the class of 2020.

post_text:
Beginning Friday, April 10 we will be joining other school districts and communities by turning on our ballfield lights every Friday night through May 15 at 8:20 pm, which is 20:20 military time. The lights will be on for 20 minutes and 20 seconds to honor the senior class of 2020.

Please continue to follow CDC guidance and stay safe and healthy.

We are greatly going to miss this year’s seniors and are heartbroken their 4th quarter had to end like this.

Please continue to follow CDC guidance and stay safe and healthy.

We are greatly going to miss this year’s seniors and are heartbroken their 4th quarter had to end like this.

post_text:
The Governor of Missouri just announced that all schools in Missouri should remain closed for the 2019-2020 school year.

We are heartbroken that we will not get to complete the year with our students.

We will update you when we know more information.

https://www.ksdk.com/mobile/article/news/local/missouri-schools-closed-through-end-of-school-year/63-d90b8dac-ea63-41eb-8b8f-83977a1db591

text: We miss you.

post_text: Unfortunately AV will have to move to pickup only for breakfast and lunches beginning Wednesday, April 1st. Bus Routes will no longer be ran. Pickup will be available at the Elementary School Loop from 10:00 am to 1:00 PM. Kids do not have to be present at pickup.
text: Unfortunately AV will have to move to pickup only for breakfast and lunches beginning Wednesday, April 1st. Bus Routes will no longer be ran. Pickup will be available at the Elementary School Loop from 10:00 am to 1:00 PM. Kids do not have to be present at pickup.

post_text: We have joined the other MAAA School Districts in extending the current School Closure through April 30 to align with the President's federal distancing guidelines.
text: We have joined the other MAAA School Districts in extending the current School Closure through April 30 to align with the President's federal distancing guidelines.

post_text: Food Delivery service is back up and running today! Buses leave AV at 10:00 AM.

post_text: The AV Tigers eSports team competed in their first ever competition recently! The contest also showcased employers in technology related fields and college programs for the students to talk to and discuss potential future pathways.
text: The AV Tigers eSports team competed in their first ever competition recently! The contest also showcased employers in technology related fields and college programs for the students to talk to and discuss potential future pathways.

post_text: We were so sad to see the AV Youth Basketball League season cut short. We appreciate the hours the coaches and AVYB board members put into it working with our kids each year. We also appreciate them donating this new score clock for use by all teams practicing in the Elementary School gym. Thank you AV Youth Basketball!
text: We were so sad to see the AV Youth Basketball League season cut short. We appreciate the hours the coaches and AVYB board members put into it working with our kids each year. We also appreciate them donating this new score clock for use by all teams practicing in the Elementary School gym. Thank you AV Youth Basketball!

post_text: Congratulations to Gracee Smith 2020 All State Girls Basketball! #AVTigerPride
shared_text:
DAILYJOURNALONLINE.COM
Four MAAA basketball players named all-state

Daily Journal Online
March 25 at 6:27 PM ·

A talented girls junior class remained a cornerstone of MAAA basketball throughout the recent season. Three members of that group have earned the top individual accolade.

post_text: Rain or Shine... Food Delivery free to ALL kids 18 and under! Pickup also available at the Elementary School Loop between 10 am and noon. Parent or older sibling can pick up for the little ones at the bus stops.
text: Rain or Shine... Food Delivery free to ALL kids 18 and under! Pickup also available at the Elementary School Loop between 10 am and noon. Parent or older sibling can pick up for the little ones at the bus stops.

post_text:
Big shout out to OPAA!, our Food Service Staff, our Bus Drivers, and other Faculty and Staff for getting 700+ meals ready to be delivered to our kids this morning!

Reminder: meals available at all bus stops and at the elementary school loop.

#AVTigerPride
